results.title: Layout and handling in factories
results.brief_description: The effect on production costs, time and workers’ well-being of imperfect factory layout. Various examples show that regrouping of existing equipment and the addition of new can significantly increase productivity and repay capital outlay.
results.description: The effect on production costs, time and workers’ well-being of imperfect factory layout. Various examples show that regrouping of existing equipment and the addition of new can significantly increase productivity and repay capital outlay.

results.title: Laying it on the line
results.creator_credit: Ron V. Brown, R and R Productions and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Gives a general overview of the method of planning excavation, laying and testing of two types of drainage materials - stoneware and PVC pipes. The need for correct installation methods current with present procedures are clearly shown.

results.title: Lay lady lay
results.creator_credit: J. Hekrdla, Vladimir Jirawck and Kratky Film
results.brief_description: Presents a clever, animated statement on morale and productivity, two key problems in every business field. An overworked hen is rejuvenated after a visit to her company psychiatrist.

results.title: Lawson's Australia (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Fred Dumar, Jim Brown and Michael Dickinson
results.brief_description: This video looks at Lawson through the poems he wrote at various stages of his life and gives a deep insight into Lawson’s complex character. What makes Henry Lawson a powerful writer is that he tapped his impoverished childhood and unhappy adult life to produce poetry and prose of great beauty. By walking hundreds of miles across the continent of Australia, he developed a unique understanding of the outback men and women and his writing captures the nature of the tough breed of people who settled in a harsh, unforgiving land.

results.title: Laws of heredity
results.creator_credit: David Bennett and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology Program. Unit 5. Heredity and Adaptive Change”.
Shows how inheritance is determined in statistically predictable ways. Presents the insights and conclusions about inheritance that were first discovered by Gregor Mendel. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Lawn tennis and how to play it: the service
results.brief_description: First of a series of six instructional films supervised by Captain H.R. Brand, this film shjows a number of important points about the service which every aspiring tennis champion must know. Demonstrations are given by Mary Heeley and Horace Skeet, All England Tennis Club Professional and Coach.

results.title: Lawn tennis and how to play it. No. 4. The Volley and smash
results.brief_description: Demonstrations by Horace Skeet, Mary Heeley, Miki and other celebrated players. Emphasises the importance of correct positioning of the feet for backhand and forehand volleys, and points out that it is better to place a volley rather than give it power. The smash is seen to be executed in the same way as a serve.

results.title: Law: a system of order
results.creator_credit: McGraw-Hill Films and Telemated Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: Conflict is inevitable in life and each individual must give up some of their freedom in order to live peaceably in proximity with others. This film looks at some of the origins of law in earlier cultures, their mode of enforcement, and examines also a range of human actions subject to social censure - from abuses of custom to serious criminal offences.
